poem:
Title: Advocacy in London's Heartbeat 

In the granite veins of London,
A Kenton-born pulse echoes.
The scholar of laws, its quiet tide,
Against truncheon, papers and time, collides.

2003 crowned her Liberty's guide,
And in her stride,
Her advocacy abides,
Unyielding as the tides.

A life peer she did confide,
In legal chambers, her courage rides,
Shadowing England, her pride,
A lady's journey, amplified.
